rulings.text: If a library contains multiple consecutive face-up cards and they reach the top, first simultaneously put them onto the stack in the same order they were in the library, then finish casting them (announce targets, etc) from bottom to top. The card that was topmost in the library will resolve first.
Revealing, looking at, searching, shuffling, or otherwise reordering face-up cards in a library turns them face down.

Casting a card with premonition interrupts whatever you're doing. For example, if the 3rd card in your library is face up and you resolve Preordain (“Scry 2, then draw a card.”), moving both cards to the bottom of your library, then you will first cast the face-up card and then draw the card that was originally 4th from the top.

When you look at or reveal cards in a library, those cards are still in that library. For example, if the 2nd card in your library is face up and you scry 1, you only cast the face-up card if you put the card you're scrying on the bottom.

cards.flavorText: "Lets try this again tomorrow."
cards.name: Possibility Agent
cards.originalText: When Possibility Agent dies, you may put it into its owner's library face up just beneath the top three cards. If you do, it gains premonition. (As a face-up card with premonition is on top of your library, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

rulings.text: If a library contains multiple consecutive face-up cards and they reach the top, first simultaneously put them onto the stack in the same order they were in the library, then finish casting them (announce targets, etc) from bottom to top. The card that was topmost in the library will resolve first.
Revealing, looking at, searching, shuffling, or otherwise reordering face-up cards in a library turns them face down.

Casting a card with premonition interrupts whatever you're doing. For example, if the 3rd card in your library is face up and you resolve Preordain (“Scry 2, then draw a card.”), moving both cards to the bottom of your library, then you will first cast the face-up card and then draw the card that was originally 4th from the top.

When you look at or reveal cards in a library, those cards are still in that library. For example, if the 2nd card in your library is face up and you scry 1, you only cast the face-up card if you put the card you're scrying on the bottom.

cards.name: Prophetic Tutor
cards.originalText:
Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library. (Shuffling turns all face-up cards in that library face down.)
Premonition 5—{1}{B} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{B} and put this card into your library face up just beneath the top five cards. As it reaches the top, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

rulings.text: If a library contains multiple consecutive face-up cards and they reach the top, first simultaneously put them onto the stack in the same order they were in the library, then finish casting them (announce targets, etc) from bottom to top. The card that was topmost in the library will resolve first.
Revealing, looking at, searching, shuffling, or otherwise reordering face-up cards in a library turns them face down.

Casting a card with premonition interrupts whatever you're doing. For example, if the 3rd card in your library is face up and you resolve Preordain (“Scry 2, then draw a card.”), moving both cards to the bottom of your library, then you will first cast the face-up card and then draw the card that was originally 4th from the top.

When you look at or reveal cards in a library, those cards are still in that library. For example, if the 2nd card in your library is face up and you scry 1, you only cast the face-up card if you put the card you're scrying on the bottom.

Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. You may put Recurrent Betrayal into your library face up just beneath the top three cards.
Premonition 3—{2}{R} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {2}{R} and put this card into your library face up just beneath the top three cards. As it reaches the top, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

rulings.text: If a library contains multiple consecutive face-up cards and they reach the top, first simultaneously put them onto the stack in the same order they were in the library, then finish casting them (announce targets, etc) from bottom to top. The card that was topmost in the library will resolve first.
Revealing, looking at, searching, shuffling, or otherwise reordering face-up cards in a library turns them face down.

Casting a card with premonition interrupts whatever you're doing. For example, if the 3rd card in your library is face up and you resolve Preordain (“Scry 2, then draw a card.”), moving both cards to the bottom of your library, then you will first cast the face-up card and then draw the card that was originally 4th from the top.

When you look at or reveal cards in a library, those cards are still in that library. For example, if the 2nd card in your library is face up and you scry 1, you only cast the face-up card if you put the card you're scrying on the bottom.

cards.name: Dreamheart Mox
cards.originalText:
Premonition 3—{0} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, pay {0} and put this card into your library face up just beneath the top three cards. As it reaches the top, cast it without paying its mana cost.)
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

rulings.text: If a library contains multiple consecutive face-up cards and they reach the top, first simultaneously put them onto the stack in the same order they were in the library, then finish casting them (announce targets, etc) from bottom to top. The card that was topmost in the library will resolve first.
Revealing, looking at, searching, shuffling, or otherwise reordering face-up cards in a library turns them face down.

Casting a card with premonition interrupts whatever you're doing. For example, if the 3rd card in your library is face up and you resolve Preordain (“Scry 2, then draw a card.”), moving both cards to the bottom of your library, then you will first cast the face-up card and then draw the card that was originally 4th from the top.

When you look at or reveal cards in a library, those cards are still in that library. For example, if the 2nd card in your library is face up and you scry 1, you only cast the face-up card if you put the card you're scrying on the bottom.
